title: Making Energy More Affordable With Solar Power: An interview with Deep Chakraborty of Enact Solar - Renewable Energy Magazine
summary: Pacific Gas and Electric (PG&E) is advocating for another increase in energy rates to cover costs from storm damages and wildfire mitigation. Enact Solar CEO Deep Chakraborty discusses how solar power can help mitigate economic pressures from rising utility costs. The company has made efforts to simplify solar installation and financing, making it more accessible to a wider range of consumers, including low-income households. California's solar market is booming, driven by state mandates and incentives aimed at promoting renewable energy.

title: Details emerge about DOE 'super‑grid' renewable study - E&E News by POLITICO
summary: A study suggests the construction of a $80 billion transmission 'super-grid' across the U.S. could enhance economic benefits by transmitting surplus renewable energy to urban areas. The study indicates significant advantages in linking the eastern and western grid, although the findings are stalled as the DOE has called for further analysis. The lead researcher acknowledges potential political implications but stresses the primary goal is to improve energy distribution efficiently and reliably, particularly for renewable resources.

summary: Holcim has made significant progress in sustainability, with 45% of its operations powered by renewable energy and record sales of sustainable cement products in 2023. title: Cotton has a waste problem: This startup says it can solve it - GreenBiz
summary: Evrnu, a Seattle-based startup, is set to break ground on a cotton recycling facility in South Carolina in 2024, aiming to create a commercial-scale circular economy for cotton. The facility will use renewable energy and produce the equivalent of 80,000 T-shirts annually from recycled cotton clothing, addressing the textile recycling deficit. Evrnu's technology transforms old garments into new fibers, collaborating with Pangaia to create entirely recycled denim products. By promoting sustainable textiles and raising awareness about environmentally harmful practices, Evrnu strives to revolutionize the apparel industry.

title: German researchers claim record-breaking 14.46% efficiency for organic PV module - pv magazine International
summary: Researchers at FAU in Germany have developed an organic PV module with a power conversion efficiency of 14.46%, surpassing the previous record of 13.1%. A paper detailing these advancements is in preparation.

title: Green Mountain to start data centre expansion in London - Data Centre Magazine
summary: Green Mountain is expanding its LON1-East data center in Romford, UK, adding 14MW of capacity powered entirely by renewable energy to meet the growing demand for data services. The expansion aims to achieve a Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) of 1.2, improving energy efficiency. Furthermore, the company is replacing diesel backup power with hydrotreated vegetable oil (HVO) fuel, reducing CO2 emissions significantly. This initiative reflects Green Mountain's commitment to providing low-carbon data center solutions.

title: University of Nottingham research partnership results in groundbreaking new industry tech - The Manufacturer
summary: Researchers from the University of Nottingham partnered with Sprint Electric to develop the Generis AC regen drive, a power converter designed to enhance the efficiency of electric motors and contribute to renewable energy applications. This innovation, showcased at the Smart Production Solutions exhibition, represents a significant advancement in AC drive technology, eliminating the need for a DC link and improving energy efficiency and performance. The collaboration under Knowledge Transfer Partnerships has not only benefited Sprint Electric but could also transform the electronic motor industry and enhance the university's research funding potential. The initiative exemplifies the successful merging of academic theory and business practice to create impactful technological advancements.

title: Daikin unveils series of residential air-to-air heat pumps - pv magazine International
summary: Daikin Europe NV has launched a new residential air-to-air heat pump line, the Nepura series, designed for cold climates and capable of operating at temperatures down to -30 C. This product replaces the Optimised Heating 4 series and features enhanced outdoor unit structure to prevent ice build-up. The Nepura series uses difluoromethane (R32) as the refrigerant and boasts a seasonal coefficient of performance (SCOP) of 4.85 to 5.17. The systems incorporate functions like 'weather compensation' and 'fireplace logic' to optimize heating efficiency.
green_innovation: TRUE - The Nepura series contributes to environmental sustainability by efficiently heating homes in cold climates while minimizing energy consumption and using a refrigerant (R32) that is less harmful to the environment.

title: Rab updates to Gore-Tex ePE membrane - Innovation in Textiles
summary: Rab has updated its Autumn/Winter 2023 waterproof glove collection by replacing its previous Gore-Tex membrane with the new PFC-free Gore-Tex ePE membrane, which has a lower carbon impact while maintaining comparable performance. The new gloves also feature recycled insulation and a durable leather, enhancing comfort and sustainability. For the Autumn/Winter 2024 collection, more products will include details on renewable energy used in production.
